newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices steady ahead of holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices steady ahead of holiday.

text.p: Indian cotton prices held steady on Wednesday in a narrow price band ahead of a local holiday, dealers said.
"Demand from millers as well as yarn manufacturers remained low but thin supplies kept prices intact," one dealer said.

The markets are shut on Thursday for a local religious festival and will reopen on Friday. In spot deals Bengal-deshi traded at 825/850 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned was unchanged at 1,675/1,690. Gujarat Kalyan (medium staple) was steady at 12,000/12,400 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) while Kala-ginned was steady at 9,600/9,700 rupees.
